data.title: Small jewel in San Ramon
data.text: This is my favorite place for dinner. The food is always interesting  with a menu that changes quite often. The owners and staff are friendly and attentive without being overbearing. It is quiet and perfect for a romantic dinner or dinner with friends.

data.title: Strip mall surprise
data.text: Discovered accidentally when killing time getting car fixed across the street. This gem isn't unknown to others though! It's bakery had been well loved for years and locals seem to flick here. No outside ambience but the inside is lovely and food delicious. I had spetzle and a lovely glass of wine. Unique menu and friendly counter service. Darling cafe!

data.title: Bakery and Lunch, yum
data.text: Homelike, comfortable atmosphere. The chicken salad puff pastry things are great and they run out some days. It's a great place to meet a friend for lunch and chat as long as  you want. They have healthy food and then there is the bakery with fancy stuff. The service is order at the counter and the food is brought to you.

data.title: Gourmet lunch food (and now dinner) plus a top bakery.
data.text:
Chicken Gougere with salad (a puff pastry with chicken salad), Meatloaf Sandwich with salad, great soups, salmon plate, etc. All on the lunch menu.  The Breakfast menu is coffee or tea and one of their scones (or muffins, or cookies, etc). Dinner 5 nights a week but I have not been for dinner.
A cafe atmosphere in a small shopping strip. Not an upscale area but flocks of people find it and love it.  Also a great place to get a big table or go out to the few outside tables.

data.title: Best bakery in town!
data.text: This is my go to place every time I need to satisfy my sweet tooth.You have to try everything once .... And you will always come back !

data.title: Favorite bakery!
data.text: I love this place for deserts, breakfast, lunch, AND dinner.  The folks are nice the food is exceptionally delcious and the choices are super!  Love this place.  Lots of parking!!

data.title: Great for lunch and best bakery in Tri-Valley area
data.text: I have been going to Cafe Attila for 10+ years now and they are the best bakery in the Tri-Valley area and also have great lunch as well. Yes, it is in a strip mall and somewhat in a discreet location but well worth the trip.

data.title: Great Desserts
data.text:
We stayed at the Hyatt House around the corner and wanted to find a place to get something sweet and some coffee one afternoon and stumbled upon Cafe Attila. Very quaint place, friendly, clean environment and great atmosphere. A surprise to find in the surrounding strip mall, which isn't much to be desired.

Desserts were great as was the service. We had 1 mango cream cake and 1 chocolate passion fruit tart. Both were delicious. We also had 2 lattes. Coffee was good, not great but good. Total was around $19.

I would come again :)

data.title: Wow!  What a delicious surprise!
data.text: We've been buying pastries from Attila for years when it was a bakery but only recently had a meal there since is has graduated into a cafe.  We were delightfully surprised with the superb food.  Obviously the secret is out as the place was mobbed when we arrived for lunch.  We got the last table.  My husband and I both had the meatloaf sandwich with salad.  It was on a luscious bun with a delicious bit of an unusual mustard on the side.  It was positively succulent.  Wine was by the glass with a limited selection but what I had was excellent.  My husband had dessert which was also delicious.  The place was noisy and the tables were close together but we would definitely go back since the food was outstanding and the prices very reasonable.

data.title: Great Food at a Crummy Setting
data.text: This Cafe is located in a decrepit strip mall.  It has outdoor dining but you are sitting in a pot holed parking lot.  Inside is another world.  The food is expertly prepared and presented.  The dining room is pleasant.  You order at the counter which is a bit of a turn off for some but it is worth the inconvenience.  We've only been there for lunch.  It is quite busy but noise is not an issue when I've been there.  It's not fast food so don't try this on your 30 minute lunch break.  Do save room for a goodie from the bakery.

data.title: Little Gem in San Ramon
data.text: I love this place.  Great place for lunch.  Their food is consistently good.  Only issue is that it gets really crowded during lunch time, otherwise I would be visiting this place more often.  Hoping they will expand!

data.title: Boring outside, delicious inside
data.text:
After hearing great things about this place, four of us decided to go to Cafe Attila on a Thursday for lunch. It was surprising to see it is in the most boring looking strip center. All the signage is plain, each place is small, and parking at lunch is a challenge. You could easily just drive on by, but the food is worth going inside.

Walking in you first see the most perfect looking desserts. Cookies, cakes, tarts. Seeing these first is a great reminder to save room for dessert. This is a small place nice place. It doesn't have elaborate decor. You don't have to dress up.  It can get a little loud depending on the crowd.  But the food could challenge any place. 

The food comes to you looking as perfect as the desserts in the front. The portions are normal size - not huge, but not tiny. We had a variety of orders (chicken, salmon, pasta). All the food seemed fresh and cooked with skill. The menu was only one page long, but the variety should satisfy everyone. Prices are also normal. Our dishes were $13-15 each.

Be sure to leave room for dessert, or take some home. We tried the tarts, tiramisu, and a chocolate pyramid cake. These desserts were almost too pretty to eat...almost. So scrumptious! 

None of us had been here before. All of us said we absolutely would come back.

data.title: High quality food at a moderate price
data.text: Great place for lunch especially but open for breakfast and dinner also.  And Oh those wonderful desserts!

data.title: A hidden gem
data.text: For such a small out of the way place the food is good and of very high quality.Great coffee. Delicious soups! Has cakes, cookies etc. too.Recently remodeled and is very inviting. Only down side is that the menu is limited and doesn't get changed often enough. Plus not too long ago they raised their prices quite a bit. No longer a bargain.

data.title: Always Consistant
data.text:
Enjoy everything I've eaten here.  Fav Lunch:  Spaetzel 
Bakery end is Great.  Order Mango Mousse Cake for Warm Day Parties & Specialty Cakes for Holiday. Always a hit.

data.title: One of San Ramon's best
data.text: We've been coming to Atilla's for years. They started as a bakery- in fact they made our daughter's wedding cake. They moved to a larger store and slowly expanded into breakfast, lunch and now dinner. Everything that comes out of the kitchen, whether bakery or breakfast/lunch/dinner is fantastic. They take obvious pride in their product and it shows. The menu is not large but everything on it is really good!

data.title: Gemlike restaurant.....
data.text: Excellent food and excellent bakery! If you go there for breakfast, by 10 o'clock they literally ran out of scones !Scones, muffins, fruit pies...delicious! For dinner, I love everything they have . the service is excellent!   I have been there many times , never had a bad experience . Superb!

data.title: One of my favorite places!
data.text: When I first started visiting this business, they only did pastries and cakes.  Now they serve food and it is delicious!  I can get my sweet and savory in one stop!  The owners are so delightful and the sweetest people ever!

data.title: Wonderful food choices, well prepared, and economically priced
data.text: The menu contains a very diverse set of offerings in relatively short form. The food was well prepared and well presented and, of course, delicious!  Entrees were mid-tier pricing (for lunch) but top-tier quality.  I've only been there once, but I am very much looking forward to my second trip as well as possibly enjoying some of the pastry miracles in their showcase area.

data.title: A real gem in San Ramon
data.text: Lovely combination bakery cafe.  Fantastic made to order cakes plus a variety of desserts, cookies, muffins.  Excellent cuisine (particularly pasta)  Good service.  Pleasant atmosphere.  It really doesn't get any better than this in a small town eatery.  I'll take a cake from this bakery wayyyyy over Whole Foods or a market ANY day of the year (and I do!)
